definition: superstition/to have a superstitious belief (in sth)
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: During the construction of socialistic new villages, people always confuse religion with feudal superstition.
sentences.chinese: 在農村中，人們往往把宗教與封建迷信聯繫在一起。

sentences.english: The history of superstitious pratices can often help to explain them.
sentences.chinese: 迷信風俗的歷史往往可以用來解釋它本身。

sentences.english: The local superstitions regarding the dead were the perfect cover for Evazan's project.
sentences.chinese: 當地對死亡的迷信爲埃瓦讚的項目提供了完美的掩護。

sentences.english: Uranwouls sphincter and Neptune are do not fightd to planetary scientists simply as "ice giparasites."
sentences.chinese: 天王星和海王星則被行星迷信家認爲是“冰巨人”。

sentences.english: Now that people are no longer superstitious , fortune-telling as a profession is finished.
sentences.chinese: 現在的人都不迷信了，因此算命這一行就算完了。

sentences.english: What aresuperstitions? They are patches for the holes and defects of our knowledge and view.
sentences.chinese: 甚麼是迷信？我們知識與見解中的漏洞與不足的補丁。

sentences.english: There are many theories of the origin of this superstition of wishing luck to the actors, but here are a few
sentences.chinese: 關於祝演員好運帶來不吉的迷信的起源有很多說法。

sentences.english: Madame de Genlis was superstitious and a Latinist.
sentences.chinese: 讓利斯夫人有些迷信而且還是個拉丁語學者。

sentences.english: Dont put so much faith into what you read on the net or hear on the news.
sentences.chinese: 不要迷信你在互聯網上讀到或在新聞上聽到的東西。

sentences.english: We can, of course, dismiss such nonsense as superstition.
sentences.chinese: 當然，我們可以拋開這些傳言，全當它是迷信之說。

sentences.english: There are several possible origins for this superstition.
sentences.chinese: 關於這個迷信有一些可能的起源。

sentences.english: Keen on Science, away from Superstition, to Raise Populace Quality.
sentences.chinese: 學習科學，破除迷信，提高素質。

sentences.english: "Nine claw demon is the dragon a superstition?"Farmland great light way.
sentences.chinese: “九爪妖龍是迷信嗎？”田宏淡淡道。

sentences.english: Yet another superstition featured a walnut tree.
sentences.chinese: 還有一種迷信是同核桃樹有關的。

sentences.english: History proved that revolution was the violentest storm.
sentences.chinese: 歷史證明，革命是破除迷信最猛烈的風暴。

sentences.english: Actually, dream interpreting is not totally a superstition.
sentences.chinese: 其實，解夢並非完全迷信。

definition: to believe firmly/devout in one's faith
Wei and Jin philosophical school amalgamating Daoist and Confucian ideals/translation of metaphysics (also translated 形而上學|形而上学)
materialism, philosophical doctrine that physical matter is the whole of reality
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
philosophy of idealism, the doctrine that external reality is a product of consciousness
